January 12, 1928
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
It is a relief to know that you have
recovered from your recent illness. I understand
from your letter that you resumed your work on your
Father's book on half-time on January 10th, and I am
informing the Comptroller accordingly.
div1.closer:
With best wishes, I am
Very sincerely yours, W. A. Sawyer Miss Laura A. Carter
The Westmoreland
2122 California Street NW
Washington, D.C.
